schweitzer: The fine solo cantata for tenor...proprobably belongs to the later Weimar period. It consists of two exquisitely beautiful arias; the accompaniment is for flute, oboe and violin.   - 2-140

name: Singet dem Herrn ein neues Lied
Gloria in excelsis Deo
Nun danket alle Gott
Ihr Tore zu Zion
Höchsterwünschtes Freudenfest
schweitzer: The other sacred occasional cantata… was composed for the dedication of the organ at Stormthal, near Leipzig.   - 2-165  It is especially interesting from the fact that it is cast in the form of an orchestral suite.   - 2-165

name: Dem Gerechten muß das Licht immer wieder aufgehen
Der Herr denket an uns
Gott ist unsre Zuvericht
Ehre sei Gott in der Höhe
Laß, Fürstin! laß noch einen Strahl
schweitzer: The people had venerated the sufferer almost like a saint.   - 2-204  Rust did this splendid work the great service… - 2-208

name: Mein Herze schwimmt im Blut
Bekennen will ich seinen Namen
Geschwinde, ihr wirbelnden Winde (Der Streit Phoebus und Pan)
schweitzer: Bach's heart was lightened when, in the aria of Phoebus and that of Tmolus, he had represented his art as that of godlike charm; the pessimism… was now overcome.  - 2-277

name: Weichet nur, betrubte Schatten
schweitzer: A specially delightful piece of work is the secular Wedding Cantata for solo soprano… - 2-266  The theme is the passing of winter and the coming of spring…. To this expressive poem Bach has written some particularly beautiful music.   - 2-266  The sopranos especially should plead for the solo cantatas O angenehme Melodei and Weichei nur, betriibte Schatten.  - 2-294
event: Secular Cantata to celebrate a wedding

name: Amore traditore
schweitzer: The first is set for bass and clavier accompaniment — a unique case with Bach.  - 2-292
event: Secular Cantata for an unknown event

name: Ich bin in mir vergnügt.  Von der Vergnügsamkeit
schweitzer: ...the true contentment is peace and quietness in God. Thus the work that began in such banahty ends with the praise of "divine sufficiency", that makes the poor rich and on the level of princes. This was the spiritual state of the great German mystic Bach, whose outward semblance was that of a comfortable citizen of the eighteenth century.  - 2-280
event: Secular Cantata for an unknown event

name: Zerreisset, zersprenget, zertrummert die Gruft.                      Der zufriedengestellte Aeolus
schweitzer: ...this splendid work.   - 2-270   The music is particularly vivacious.   - 2-269
event: Dramma per Musica, for the Birthday of Augustus Friedrich Müller, a Professor at Leipzig University

name: Schleicht, spielende Wellen, und murmelt gelinde
schweitzer: The text is by Picander, who again did Bach the service of supplying him with a poem exceedingly rich in musical motives.  - 2-286  Bach was particularly fond of representing in music the motion of waves. … The best piece of painting of this kind is perhaps the delightful one of the waves in the cantata Schleicht, spielende Wellen...  - 2-74  For the dynamics of Bach's vocal music the following works may be recommended for study :...  - 2-409
event: Dramma per Musica, for the Birthday of Augusus III

name: Vereinigte Zwietracht der wechselnden Saiten
event: Secular Cantata In honour of Gottlieb Kortte, on his appointment as Professor
Secular Cantata In honour of Gottlieb Kortte, on his appointment as Professor

name: Auf, schmetternde Töne der muntern Trompeten
event: Secular Cantata for Elector Augustus III’s Birthday

name: Was mir behagt, ist nur die muntre Jagd! Jagdkantate
schweitzer: The music is uncomm.only expressive and of captivating freshness.   - 2-262   Bach evidently worked at it con amore.  - 2-261    Bach's master, Duke Ernst Wilhelm, was invited, and surprised his friend with a "fine table-music".  - 2-261
event: for the birthday of Duke Christian of Sachsen-Weißenfels

name: Non sa che sia dolore
event: Farewell Cantata for Johann Matthias Gesner on his posting to Ansbach ?

name: O holder Tag, erwunschte Zeit
schweitzer: This cantata probably belongs to Bach's last creative period; it is a specimen of that art of "charm" on which he prides himself in Phoebus und Pan.   - 2-291      For the dynamics of Bach's vocal music the following works may be recommended for study :...  - 2-409

name: O angenehme Melodei
Schweigt stille, plaudert nicht – Kaffeekantate
event: performed by the Collegium Musicum in Zimmermann's Coffee House

name: Mer hahn en neue Oberkeet. Bauern-Kantate
schweitzer: The idea of writing a piece of rustic music did not come inopportunely to Bach, for he had a strong penchant to burlesque. Almost all the movements are set in the form of dance-tunes…  - 2-290
event: in hommage  of Carl Heinrich von Dieskau of Klein-Zschocher

name: Laßt uns sorgen, laßt uns wachen. Herkules auf dem Scheidewege
schweitzer: Pleasure and Virtue each try to capture Hercules,…  - 2-280    The music Bach has written to Picander's poem is, with all its charm and urbanity, full of characterisation.  - 2-281

name: Gedenke, Herr, wie es uns gehet!

Wer sucht die Pracht, wer wünscht den Glanz
Mein Odem ist schwach
text: Johann Ernst Bach (His vocal works are often highly dramatic and full of effects - Christoph Wolff)
